title: Sydney Autumn Racing Carnival dates, tickets, fashion; Golden Slipper, The Championships, Doncaster Mile, Queen Elizabeth Stakes, Sydney Cup, TJ Smith Stakes; Royal Randwick; Rosehill Gardens | Perth Now
text:
Sydney Autumn Carnival race dates 2017 News Corp Australia Network February 16, 2017 1:59pm 
WHETHER you only have the occasional flutter or just a passing interest in horses, these dates are the most important collection you’ll assemble this autumn for your social calendar. 
Sydney’s autumn racing carnival features the running of world’s richest race for two-year-olds — the Golden Slipper at Rosehill Gardens, and The Championships, run over two consecutive Saturdays in April, at Royal Randwick. media_camera Champion mare Winx will be the star attraction this autumn. Picture: Jenny Evans 
Over almost two months, including the Easter long weekend, punters, celebrities and budding fashionistas will flock to Rosehill Gardens and Royal Randwick for one of Sydney’s great sporting and social events of year as Australia’s best racehorses pursue Group 1 glory on the track. 
Be warned, it’s a long campaign, so select your meetings wisely. Don’t burn yourself out too early and remember, gamble responsibly. ROYAL RANDWICK: SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 25 
MAIN EVENT: Group 1 Chipping Norton Stakes (1600m) - Champion mare Winx will headline the first Group 1 race in Sydney for 2017. The mighty mare will be chasing her 15th straight win and her 10th Group 1 success. She will meet a similar field to the one she belted first-up in the Apollo Stakes. The winner of the race will be exempt from a ballot for the Doncaster Mile and Sydney Cup later in the autumn. 
PRIZEMONEY: $600,000 
2016 WINNER: Winx, Hugh Bowman 
OTHER RACES: Group 2 Guy Walter Stakes (1400m), Group 2 Surround Stakes (1400m), Group 2 Sweet Embrace Stakes (1200m), Group 2 Skyline Stakes (1200m). 
TICKETS: australianturfclub.com.au ROYAL RANDWICK: SATURDAY, MARCH 4 
MAIN EVENT: Group 1 Randwick Guineas (1600m) - The first leg of the Triple Crown for three-year-olds, which includes the Rosehill Guineas (2000m) and Australian Derby (2400m). The winner of this race is also exempt from a ballot for the Doncaster Mile and Australian Derby. 
PRIZEMONEY: $1,000,000 
2016 WINNER: Le Romain, Christian Reith 
OTHER RACES: Group 1 Canterbury Stakes (1300m), Group 2 Challenge Stakes (1000m), Group 2 Reisling Stakes (1200m), Group 2 Todman Stakes (1200m). 
TICKETS: australianturfclub.com.au LADIES DAY (ROSEHILL GARDENS): SATURDAY, MARCH 11 
MAIN EVENT: Group 1 Coolmore Classic (1500m) - The autumn target for most of the best sprinting fillies and mares in the country. The winner is exempt from ballot for the Doncaster Mile and Queen Of The Turf Stakes. 
PRIZEMONEY: $600,000 
2016 WINNER: Peeping, Sam Clipperton 
OTHER RACES: Group 2 Ajax Stakes (1500m), Group 2 Phar Lap Stakes (1500m).
